documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a cloudy night
text: tonight will be cloudy at times with spots of drizzle in places and local mist .
here 's your full weather forecast
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: appeal to bulwell community following stabbing
text: police have said the family of 17-year-old lyrico steede is `` devastated '' about his death .
the teenager , known to his friends as rico , was stabbed while in the bulwell area of nottingham last week .
nottinghamshire police said they are `` determined to catch those responsible '' and have urged the community of bulwell to help them get justice .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hospital 'terribly sorry ' after boy 's death
text: a senior doctor at the leicester royal infirmary has told an inquest that her department is `` terribly , terribly sorry '' after the death of a three-year-old boy with down 's syndrome .
krishan saujani died at the lri in november 2015 from bronchial pneumonia .

he 'd been diagnosed with dehydration and gastroenteritis on arrival at the hospital but was kept in the resuscitation area for about three hours before being moved on to the children 's assessment unit .
the events leading up to his death have already been investigated by the crown prosecution service , which found there was no case to answer in terms of a criminal prosecution .
a coroner is now hearing the inquest into his death at leicester 's town hall .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: burst water pipe on busy road
text: if you 're about to head south out of leicester , this burst water pipe might cause you some delays .
in # leicester - there 's a water leak in the middle of the junction of welford road and victoria park road , care needed as there 's a lot of water , repairs will have to take place .
further details of restrictions when we have them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: breakingteenager dies after bulwell stabbing
text: a 17-year-old boy has died after being stabbed in bulwell .
lyrico steede ( below ) was taken to hospital after being attacked by a group of people in the area of stock well at about 19:30 on tuesday , february 13 .
nottinghamshire police said the attack happened on several streets including lathkill close , lillington road and stock well .
the force is appealing for anyone with personal or business cctv to let them know .
they also want to hear from anyone who may have been driving through the area between 19:00 and 19:45 with a dashcam .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: woman , 20 , charged with man 's murder
text: woman , 20 , charged with man 's murder

documents.title: watch : how baking is helping with lupus
text: a woman from nottingham has been explaining how baking helps her with her condition .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: woman charged with hucknall killing
text: a 20-year-old woman has been charged with murder after a man was discovered with fatal injuries at a house in hucknall .
christopher pearson was found with life-threatening injuries at the property on strathmore close on sunday .
the 39-year-old was taken to hospital where he later died .
demi harris , of the same address , who was arrested at the scene , is due to appear at nottingham magistrates ' court tomorrow .
nottinghamshire police said the post-mortem examination to determine the cause of death has taken place , but they have not released details of mr pearson 's injuries .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News

documents.title: anger at £ 4k disabled parking charge
text: anger at £ 4k disabled parking charge

documents.title: cctv appeal over aldi purse theft
text: police would like to speak to these two men about the theft of an elderly woman 's purse from a supermarket .
the 78-year-old victim had been shopping at aldi in littleover on 11 november last year when she noticed her purse was missing .
later that day , money was taken from her bank account , police said .
the officer leading the investigation said he appreciated that the suspected theft `` happened a few months ago '' but the cctv image had only just become available to release .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: youngster signs pro deal with forest
text: nottingham forest tweets
# nffc are delighted to announce that @ twitterid has signed his first professional contract with the club .
do n't tell me this donny do n't look like michael mancienne ?
delighted for you keith , the 1st player from our 2011 @ twitterid cup winning squad to sign pro terms .
keep working hard
welcome keith , delighted to have you with us .
best of luck # nffc
the future is bright , the future is red and white .
congratulations lad
congratulations pal
well done and congrats keith - happy for you & your family , keep working hard .
good luck to you keith .
i look forward to seeing your big debut .
one word of advice though , avoid a twitter account .
some of our fans ca n't behave very well .
congratulations keith
man like keith
that will be 20 million next time you come sniffing dortmund cheers
welcome to the reds do us proud .
congratulations , here 's to a bright future # nffc
congrats mate
clearly does n't like me for some strange reason
congrats -keep on keeping on .
well done young man .
u r a proper red now .
congratulations keith -keep up the hard work .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: bombardier set to start on £ 900m order
text: work is set to begin at bombardier in derby on a major railway carriage contract .
the £ 900m order is for greater anglia , who want to use the carriages on commuter routes into london liverpool street .
it is hoped that the trains will be ready to bring into service next year .
in total , bombardier is producing 665 new carriages for the firm .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: concern over 'noisy ' clay pigeon shoots
text: residents in a village have complained that a clay pigeon shooting range is too loud .
castle shooting club has been holding fortnightly shoots in marehay , near ripley , since moving there in november .
`` once they start shooting , i start tensing up waiting for the next bang to come , '' one resident said .
others have also expressed concerns about the location of the shoots .
in response , the club has told the bbc that safety is paramount and it is looking at ways to reduce noise .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: buildings on ex-colliery site get listed status
text: three historic buildings at snibston colliery have been granted grade ii listings by historic england .
it means the old lamp room , powder magazine , and locomotive shed will be protected following the closure of the old discovery museum .
plans for a new visitor centre , and 144 new homes on the site will not be affected .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: tigers boosted by malouf and barrow returns
text: leicester tigers hope to have winger nick malouf ( and lock dom barrow available for sunday 's trip to saracens .
malouf failed a head injury assessment during tigers ' defeat at gloucester , while barrow has not played a premiership match since october .
`` nick [ malouf ] is n't training , '' tigers head coach matt o'connor said .
`` he should pass his return-to-play protocol hopefully by the back end of the week .
`` dom [ barrow ] is training and looking good so he 's available for selection . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester sports reporter

documents.title: police continue hit-and-run crash appeal
text: witness boards have been put up in leicester as police continue their appeal for information related to a hit-and-run crash .
on the evening of 8 february , a car hit a 61-year-old man on a zebra crossing , on st peter 's road .
leicestershire police have made two arrests in connection with the crash but no one has yet been charged .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: in prince william visits hinckley
text: it 's been an incredibly exciting day for the 900 staff at the triumph factory in hinckley .
prince william opened the new factory visitor experience onsite and unveiled a `` petrol tank plaque '' .
triumph 's chief commercial officer , paul stroud , told the bbc the duke of cambridge was `` clearly a passionate motorcyclist '' , asking lots of questions during the tour .
the prince also proved motorbikes were not just for for `` rebels '' by taking to two wheels .
mr stroud said prince william did ask if he could spend longer on the tiger 1200 but `` time would n't allow '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : christie vows to return to winter olym
text: elise christie has said she does not understand the disqualification that ended her winter olym in pyeongchang .
however , the nottingham-based speed skater has vowed to return to the winter olym in beijing in 2022 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: appeal to trace men on motorbike
text: police investigating an attack in clifton have released this photo of three men on a motorbike .
a man was attacked in the edenhall gardens area just after 19:30 on friday 9 february .
nottinghamshire police said : `` three men on a motorbike were said to have been involved and it 's believed they were riding around the clifton area for some time . ''
the force is appealing for help identifying the men .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: 'smart cone ' device inspired by road worker death
text: a company based near bottesford has created a device aimed at reducing the number of road worker deaths on our motorways and a roads .
highway resource solutions spent 11 years developing `` smart cones '' after hearing about the death of a worker on the a1 near grantham .
the cones contain a computer , and when hit by a vehicle they emit a piercing noise which warns workers to get out of the way .
there 's also a button , which a foreman can press if he notices a vehicle heading towards the coned-off area .
in addition , it 's hoped the cones can be used to send information about roadworks to drivers ' sat navs or google maps - and help people understand why repairs are being carried it .
it 's thought this could help reduce driver frustration .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: hales to play only white-ball for notts
text: hales to play only white-ball for notts

documents.title: award success for heights of abraham
text: the heights of abraham in derbyshire has scooped a top tourism award .
it 's the only attraction in the east midlands to win a visit england gold accolade .
it received the top honour following an annual assessment by the tourism agency .
the award puts them in an elite group of winners that includes emirates stadium , the tower of london and chester zoo .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: prince test drives new triumph
text: the duke of cambridge is really getting into the spirit of things at the triumph factory in hinckley .
the prince donned riding gear to test drive the new tiger 1200 model .
author: Victoria Hicks
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: charity head shave raises thousands
text: after years of growing her hair long , sajal amrat has just had it all shaved off to raise money for the loros hos
the fashion retail worker said : `` there 's a lot of vanity flying about our office - people are shocked i 'm doing this '' .
sajal set herself a target of £ 200 , but has raised over £ 3,000 .
adrian walker from loros said the money will be used to help the charity do things like feed patients and visit those needing help at home .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: paralympic great praises station staff
text: crossbench peer baroness tanni grey-thompson has praised staff at nottingham station for helping her get on a train .
the 11-time paralympic gold medalist has been an outspoken critic of access for disabled people at railway stations .
however , in a tweet , she said staff at nottingham had been `` wonderful '' and `` did n't look down '' on her .
nottingham station today fabulous .
has n't booked as did n't know what time i could get there .
no hassle .
did n't look down on me as i had n't booked .
put me on a train ! ! !
it can be done .
success is when it is the norm not something that needs tweeting
yes .
it should be possible to have the same experience of commuting as everyone else
have you seen the whizz kids video and the assembly debate on transport
tag them so that they know !
could n't find an account for them
shame .
emt staff , both on stations and on trains , are very good .
i 've always found them friendly and professional .
yes .
i agree with you staff at at euston are very nice

indeed , it is relatively rare to come across rail staff that are anything else.i once saw a train manager chastise an unruly youth ( she was old enough to be his mother ) in a 'what would your mother think ' manner .
it worked well without her getting officious .
@ twitterid
that 's great to hear tanni .
you 're regards will be passed on to the station team .
thank you for taking the time to post in.^np
it 's so sad that we need to celebrate being able to access things most people do n't even have to think about
i 'm not a wheelchair user but usually have my wheely-walker and it is such a wonderful feeling when are n't made to feel like a burden or a bother
it should be done , it definitively should be done on # southernrail
that 's # nottingham for you tanni .
we do n't mess about here .
we just get on with it .
come back soon .
good to hear !
it 's the way it should be .
great to hear
shout out to oxford station - great support !
glad to hear you had a good experience in the east midlands tanni : - ) , what bought you to nottingham ?
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: prince begins tour of motorbike factory
text: the duke of cambridge has arrived at triumph in hinckley .
he 's been shown around the £ 6m spray facility , which is due to open this spring , bringing the entire motorbike production under one roof .
this was the moment the prince put the triumph badge on the chassis of a tiger 1200 .
author: Victoria Hicks
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: hucknall house death victim named
text: a man who died after being found with fatal injuries at a house in nottinghamshire has been named as christopher pearson .
the 39-year-old , who is from strathmore close , hucknall , passed away in hospital after he was found in the early hours of sunday morning .
a woman , 20 , has been arrested on sus of murder and remains in police custody .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested after girl robbed of phone
text: a 22-year-old man has been arrested on sus of robbery after a 12-year-old girl had her phone taken from her in derby .
derbyshire police have said the man is being held at st mary 's wharf police station and will be interviewed later today .
the child had her mobile phone taken following a struggle with a robber on sunday 18 february .
it happened while she was walking along cambridge street , having been to the shops on an errand for her mum .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hundreds apply to volunteer at nottingham open
text: over 200 people have applied to be volunteers at the nottingham open tennis tournament this summer .
nottingham city council said it had received 218 responses , the highest number since it launched the volunteer scheme in 2015 .
successful applications are asked to court steward and check tickets during the week-long event in june .
last year 's nottingham open final saw british number one johanna konta beaten by donna vekic .
both players have said they will be returning to the city for this year 's tournament ( 9-17 june ) .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed for trying to meet '11-year-old ' for sex
text: a 65-year-old man has been sent to prison for trying to arrange online to meet someone he thought was an 11-year-old girl for sex .
paul jarvis , of armstrong road , retford , did not realise he was actually sending messages to trained police officers .
jarvis admitted sending the messages , but in a police interview said he would not have gone through with what he had claimed .
a jury at nottingham crown court found him guilty of the arranging or facilitation of a child sex offence .
he was jailed for 15 months , made the subject of a 10-year sexual harm prevention order and put on the sex offenders ' register .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: dozens donate towards new phone for robbed girl
text: more than £ 1,300 has been raised for a 12-year-old girl who had her mobile phone stolen in derby at the weekend .
the online fundraising page started yesterday afternoon after this cctv footage was published on our facebook page .
paula wright set up the page with the aim of raising £ 600 to buy the girl a new phone .
the robbery happened on cambridge street on sunday afternoon .
the girl had been to the local shops on an errand for her mum when the man attacked her .
police would like to hear from anyone who recognises the man or has information about the robbery .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: winter olym elise christie disqualified
text: nottingham-based speed skater elise christie has been disqualified from the women 's 1,000m competition at the winter olym
she was shown a yellow card by officials for a move that was deemed to be `` unsafe , harmful or hazardous '' .
follow reaction and analysis here .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: motorway crash causing long delays
text: about to set off on the m1 ?
this might cause you some issues

# m1j21aj21
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hendrix guitar strings pack set for auction
text: a woman , who met and spoke to jimi hendrix after a gig , has found a guitar string packet belonging to the rock legend .
anthea connell , 69 , made headlines last year when an autographed note to her from hendrix fetched £ 5,700 at auction .
during the same chance meeting in 1967 , hendrix handed ms connell , from west bridgford , a second unsigned guitar string packet .
it is due to be sold at auction in etwall , derbyshire , next month .
auctioneers are expecting the item to fetch between £ 100-150 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: charity set to close coastal holiday home
text: a coastal holiday home , which has been providing breaks for underprivileged children for over 120 years , is set to close .
leicester children 's holiday centre at mablethorpe , lincolnshire , is to shut so the charity can offer `` more relevant '' holidays for 21st century children .

chairman shaun o'donnell , said : `` we have visited several fabulous holiday centres around the uk and the facilities and activities they offer are wonderful and we agree are more relevant to modern children .
`` people who have donated money or attended our events can rest assured that their money will be paying for holidays in 2018 and beyond . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: legal threat to mp over corbyn 'communist spies ' tweet
text: jeremy corbyn has threatened to sue mansfield mp ben bradley over a tweet claiming the labour leader sold british secrets to `` communist spies '' .
mr corbyn has denied a series of tabloid allegations that he had meetings with a czech intelligence agent during the 1980s .
last night a labour spokesman said he had instructed lawyers to contact mr bradley to remove the online post or face legal action .
the tweet 's since been deleted .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: car gets stuck on tram track
text: a car has been removed from the tram tracks in lenton this morning after getting stuck .
there are currently delays of between 15-20 minutes .
the tram operator , net , said it was `` working hard '' to get the timetable back to normal `` as quickly as possible '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: hinckley set for royal visit
text: prince william is due to visit triumph motorcycles in hinckley later .
the duke of cambridge will tour the factory , meet apprentices and officially open the new visitor centre .
the attraction , which opened in november 2017 , features the bike used by steve mcqueen in the great escape .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: meat firm collapse will see 'over 300 ' lose jobs
text: more than 300 jobs are set to go following the collapse of derby-based meat supplier russell hume .
the firm went into administration on monday in the wake of the food standards agency 's decision to halt production following an alleged breach of hygiene regulations .
its meat products were recalled last month and chains including wetherspoon took them off their menus .
administrators kpmg said 266 jobs would be made redundant , with 36 staff remaining to help wind down the company .
it is expected that all 302 jobs will be lost .
author: Press Association

documents.title: 'man took under woman 's skirt at checkout '
text: nottinghamshire police dealt with six cases of `` upskirting '' between 2015-17 , a freedom of information request has found .
the practice of covertly photographing under the skirts of women is not recognised as a specific offence .
the force said of these six cases , two had resulted in criminal charges .
in one case , a man was seen following a woman around a shop , and taking a up her skirt when she approached the checkout .
currently police charge alleged `` upskirters '' with other offences , but campaigners would like it recognised as a specific crime .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: a bright day , but clouding over later .
here 's rich with your outlook .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : skaters miss out on a top-10 finish
text: nottingham 's nick buckland and his partner penny coomes just missed out on a top-10 finish in the ice dance competition on day 11 of the winter olym in pyeongchang .
after qualifying in 10th , the pair came 11th after their free dance while canada 's tessa virtue and scott moir won gold with a world record of 206.07 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : latest from the roads
text: here 's how it 's looking on the region 's roads :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to tuesday across derbyshire , leicestershire , nottinghamshire and rutland .
amy woodfield and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News
